parameters.content:
# Generate Images with Pollinations AI & Blog Articles with Gemini 2.5 from Telegram


This workflow is a multi-functional Telegram bot that allows users to generate:

 - üé® AI images using Pollinations API
 - üìù AI-written blog articles using [Gemini AI via LangChain]


It uses Google Sheets to log all user activities and Google Drive to store image assets.


## üì≤ Example Commands:
image a modern smart city at sunset  
blog The Benefits of Remote Work


## ‚úÖ Features:
  - Telegram Bot with menu buttons (/start)
  - Detects message type: /start, /help, button callbacks, or free text
  - Validates format (image ... or blog ...)
  - Auto-routes command to:
  - AI Image Generator
  - Blog Article Generator
  - Lets user choose article style: Formal, Casual, News
  - Sends real-time feedback: typing, uploading, error
  - Logs each entry to Google Sheets with timestamp
  - Uploads images to Google Drive folder


## üßæ Requirements:
  - Telegram Bot Token
  - Google Sheets OAuth credential
  - Google Drive OAuth credential
  - Google Gemini API (via LangChain)

## ‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions:
1. üîê Add Credentials to your n8n:

   - Telegram API
   - Google Sheets OAuth
   - Google Drive OAuth
   - Google Gemini (PaLM) via LangChain

2. üß© Update Variables:

   - Replace Google Sheet ID and Drive Folder ID
   - Make sure chat_id expressions are dynamic (avoid hardcoding)

3. üß™ Test Commands:

   - /start ‚Üí opens main menu
   - image your prompt ‚Üí generates image
   - blog your title ‚Üí asks for style ‚Üí generates article



## üîß Customization Tips:
1. ‚úçÔ∏è Modify Gemini prompt format in Generate Article with Gemini node
2. ‚ûï Add new style types like SEO, Story, Product Review
3. üñº Add more image models (e.g., Stability AI, DALL¬∑E)
4. üìä Add category/tags to Sheets for better reporting
5. üíæ Save responses with filenames using timestamps

## üîê Security Best Practices:
1. Do NOT hardcode API keys into HTTP nodes
2. Store all credentials via n8n credential manager
3. Avoid exposing actual Sheet/Drive URLs in public templates


## üèÅ Summary:
A powerful Telegram bot for content creators that lets users generate image assets and full-length articles ‚Äî without ever leaving the chat. Ideal for bloggers, designers, educators, marketers, and developers.


## üîó Want to Learn More?
üìö https://n8n.partnerlinks.io/l3i5p47vr7s2
üìö https://github.com/pollinations/pollinations
üìö https://aistudio.google.com/apikey

## üîÅ Google Sheets Integration (üìÑ Logging System)
This workflow uses Google Sheets as a central log for all user activities and generated content.

Each time a user sends a valid prompt (image or blog), a row is appended to the spreadsheet with relevant details.



## üìä Sheet Structure
The spreadsheet is expected to have one sheet (e.g. Sheet1) with the following columns:

| Column Name | Type     | Description                                                  |
| ----------- | -------- | ------------------------------------------------------------ |
| `Tanggal`   | `string` | Date and time of the request (`new Date().toLocaleString()`) |
| `Prompt`    | `string` | The user‚Äôs original prompt (image description or blog title) |
| `User ID`   | `string` | Telegram user ID (from message/chat context)                 |
| `Jenis`     | `string` | Type of generation: `"image"` or `"blog"`                    |
| `Hasil`     | `string` | For images: the image URL; for blogs: full content           |
| `Style`     | `string` | Writing style (only applicable for blog prompts)             |



## ‚úÖ What‚Äôs Logged?
For image prompts, it stores the image description, user ID, and image URL.

For blog prompts, it stores the blog title, selected writing style, and final article content.


## ‚öôÔ∏è Customizing Google Sheets for Other Use Cases
You can adapt the column names and fields for your own use. Here are suggestions:

üìå Add a ‚ÄúCategory‚Äù column if you want to tag prompts (e.g., ‚ÄúMarketing‚Äù, ‚ÄúTravel‚Äù, ‚ÄúNews‚Äù)

üìå Track response time by adding a Latency column using Date.now() logic

üìå Include sentiment or keyword analysis with custom AI nodes

üìå Use row_number to update specific entries if needed (already used in blog article flow)


To apply custom columns:

- Open Log Image Prompt to Google Sheets, Log Blog Prompt to Google Sheets, or Log Final Article to Google Sheets node

- Add new fields in the ‚ÄúColumns‚Äù > ‚ÄúValue‚Äù section

- Map expressions or variables from the current data flow

- Make sure your spreadsheet has matching headers to avoid errors.


## üìÅ Google Drive Upload (for image)
In addition to logging to Sheets, AI-generated images are uploaded to a designated Google Drive folder for archiving.

You can change the folder ID in the Upload Image to Google Drive node and optionally rename the file to include:

User ID
Prompt
Timestamp
